definition.procedurexml: <xml xmlns="https://developers.google.com/blockly/xml"><block type="event_trigger" deletable="false" x="347" y="128"><field name="trigger">no_ext_trigger</field><next><block type="controls_if"><value name="IF0"><block type="logic_negate"><value name="BOOL"><block type="world_data_isremote"></block></value></block></value><statement name="DO0"><block type="block_nbt_num_set"><comment pinned="false" h="68" w="284">This sets a timer to delay the growth of the block. The number will increase 0.05 or at the same time that a tick runs in real-world time.</comment><value name="tagName"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT">MilkAge</field></block></value><value name="x"><block type="coord_x"></block></value><value name="y"><block type="coord_y"></block></value><value name="z"><block type="coord_z"></block></value><value name="tagValue"><block type="math_dual_ops"><field name="OP">ADD</field><value name="A"><block type="block_nbt_num_get"><value name="tagName"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT">MilkAge</field></block></value><value name="x"><block type="coord_x"></block></value><value name="y"><block type="coord_y"></block></value><value name="z"><block type="coord_z"></block></value></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">1</field><comment pinned="false" h="34" w="190">0.05 is one tick (1 / 20 = 0.05)</comment></block></value></block></value><next><block type="controls_if"><value name="IF0"><block type="math_binary_ops"><field name="OP">GTE</field><value name="A"><block type="block_nbt_num_get"><value name="tagName"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT">MilkAge</field></block></value><value name="x"><block type="coord_x"></block></value><value name="y"><block type="coord_y"></block></value><value name="z"><block type="coord_z"></block></value></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">30</field><comment pinned="false" h="83" w="414">Every 20 seconds the plant has a chance to grow to a new stage or not grow at all. Setting this to a higher number will slow the growth speed down, lowering the number will speed the growth speed up.</comment></block></value></block></value><statement name="DO0"><block type="block_replace"><field name="state">FALSE</field><field name="nbt">FALSE</field><value name="x"><block type="coord_x"></block></value><value name="y"><block type="coord_y"></block></value><value name="z"><block type="coord_z"></block></value><value name="block"><block type="mcitem_allblocks"><field name="value">CUSTOM:MilkAgerCheesed</field></block></value></block></statement></block></next></block></statement></block></next></block></xml>
